class.name: Lurjus

t.entry: one or more skills determined by your Lurjuksen vedätys

flavor: You are skilled and opportunistic. Using your sharp wits and quick reactions, you take advantage of your opponents' missteps and strike where it hurts most. You play a dangerous game, seeking thrills and testing your skills, and likely don't care much for any laws that happen to get in your way. While the path of every Lurjus is unique and riddled with danger, the one thing you all share in common is the breadth and depth of your skills.

fluff.name: During combat Encounters...
entries: You move about stealthily so you can catch foes unawares. You're a precision instrument, more useful against a tough boss or distant spellcaster than against rank-and-file soldiers.

fluff.name: During social encounters...
entries: Your skills give you multiple tools to influence your opposition. Pulling cons and ferreting out information are second nature to you.

fluff.name: While exploring...
entries: You sneak to get the drop on foes and scout for danger or traps. You're a great asset, since you can disable traps, solve puzzles, and anticipate dangers.

fluff.name: In downtime...
entries: You might pick pockets or trade in illegal goods. You can also become part of a thieves' guild, or even found one of your own.

items: Hone your skills through intense practice, both on your own and out in the world.
Know where to attain illicit goods.
Skirt or break the law because you think it's meaningless or have your own code.
Find you charming or fascinating, even if they think they know better than to trust you.
Come to you when they need someone who is willing to take risks or use questionable methods.
Suspect you're motivated primarily by greed.

summary.text: The Lurjus is a multitalented master of skulduggery who strikes when enemies least expect it.

classFeature.name: Ancestry and Background
entries: In addition to the abilities provided by your class at 1st level, you have the benefits of your selected ancestry and background, as described in Chapter 2.

classFeature.name: Initial Proficiencies
entries: At 1st level, you gain a number of proficiencies that represent your basic training. These proficiencies are noted at the start of this class.

classFeature.name: Lurjus Feats
entries: At 1st level and every even-numbered level, you gain a {@filter Lurjus class feat|feats||type=class|Class=Lurjus|level=[1;1]}.

classFeature.name: Lurjuksen vedätys
entries: As you started on the path of the Lurjus, you began to develop your own style to pursue your illicit activities. Your Vedätys shapes your Lurjus techniques and the way you approach a job, while building your reputation in the criminal underworld for a certain type of work. A client with deep pockets might even hire a team of rogues for a particular heist, each specializing in a different Vedätys, in order to cover all the bases. Choose a Lurjuksen vedätys.

classFeature.name: Skill Feats
entries: At 1st level and every level thereafter, you gain a {@filter skill feat|feats||type=skill;!archetype}.

classFeature.name: Sneak Attack
entries: When your enemy can't properly defend itself, you take advantage to deal extra damage. If you {@action Strike} a creature that has the {@condition flat-footed} condition with an {@trait agile} or {@trait finesse} melee weapon, an {@trait agile} or {@trait finesse} unarmed attack, a ranged weapon attack, or a ranged unarmed attack, you deal an extra {@dice 1d6} precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown melee weapon, that weapon must also be {@trait agile} or {@trait finesse}.
As your Lurjus level increases, so does the number of damage dice for your sneak attack. Increase the number of dice by one at 5th, 11th, and 17th levels.

classFeature.name: Surprise Attack
entries: You spring into combat faster than foes can react. On the first round of combat, if you roll {@skill Deception} or {@skill Stealth} for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are {@condition flat-footed} to you.

classFeature.name: Skill Increases
entries: You gain more skill increases than members of other classes. At 2nd level and every level thereafter, you gain a skill increase. You can use this increase to either become trained in one skill you're untrained in, or to become an expert in one skill in which you're already trained.

At 7th level, you can use skill increases to become a master in a skill in which you're already an expert, and at 15th level, you can use them to become legendary in a skill in which you're already a master.

classFeature.name: Deny Advantage
entries: As someone who takes advantage of others' defenses, you are careful not to leave such openings yourself. You aren't {@condition flat-footed} to hidden, undetected, or flanking creatures of your level or lower, or creatures of your level or lower using surprise attack. However, they can still help their allies flank.

classFeature.name: General Feats
entries: At 3rd level and every 4 levels thereafter, you gain a {@filter general feat|feats||type=general|level=[1;3]}.

classFeature.name: Deny Advantage
entries: As someone who takes advantage of others' defenses, you are careful not to leave such openings yourself. You aren't {@condition flat-footed} to {@condition hidden}, {@condition undetected}, or flanking creatures of your level or lower, or creatures of your level or lower using surprise attack. However, they can still help their allies flank.

classFeature.name: Ability Boosts
entries: At 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter, you boost four different ability scores. You can use these ability boosts to increase your ability scores above 18. Boosting an ability score increases it by 1 if it's already 18 or above, or by 2 if it starts out below 18.

classFeature.name: Ancestry Feats
entries: In addition to the ancestry feat you started with, you gain an {@filter ancestry feat|feats||type=ancestry} at 5th level and every 4 levels thereafter. The list of ancestry feats available to you can be found in your ancestry's entry in Chapter 2.

classFeature.name: Weapon Tricks
entries: You have become thoroughly familiar with the tools of your trade. You gain expert proficiency in simple weapons and unarmed attacks, as well as the rapier, sap, shortbow, and shortsword. When you critically succeed at an attack roll against a {@condition flat-footed} creature while using an {@trait agile} or {@trait finesse} simple weapon or any of the listed weapons, you apply the critical specialization effect for the weapon you're wielding.

classFeature.name: Evasion
entries: You've learned to move quickly to avoid explosions, dragons' breath, and worse. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Reflex save, you get a critical success instead.

classFeature.name: Vigilant Senses
entries: Through your adventures, you've developed keen awareness and attention to detail. Your proficiency rank for {@skill Perception} increases to master.

classFeature.name: Weapon Specialization
entries: You've learned how to inflict greater injuries with the weapons you know best. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you are an expert. This damage increases to 3 damage if you're a master, and 4 damage if you're legendary.

classFeature.name: Debilitating Strikes
entries: When taking advantage of an opening, you both hinder and harm your foe. You gain the {@action Debilitating Strike} free action.

classFeature.name: Great Fortitude
entries: Your physique is incredibly hardy. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to expert.

classFeature.name: Lurjus Expertise
entries: Your techniques are now harder to resist. Your proficiency rank for your Lurjus class DC increases to expert.

classFeature.name: Improved Evasion
entries: You elude danger to a degree that few can match. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to legendary. When you roll a critical failure on a Reflex save, you get a failure instead. When you roll a failure on a Reflex save against a damaging effect, you take half damage.

classFeature.name: Incredible Senses
entries: You notice things almost impossible for an ordinary person to detect. Your proficiency rank for {@skill Perception} increases to legendary.

classFeature.name: Light Armor Expertise
entries: You've learned how to dodge while wearing light or no armor. Your proficiency ranks for light armor and unarmored defense increase to expert.

classFeature.name: Master Tricks
entries: You've mastered a Lurjus's fighting moves. Your proficiency ranks increase to master for all simple weapons and unarmed attacks plus the rapier, sap, shortbow, and shortsword.

classFeature.name: Double Debilitation
entries: Your opportunistic attacks are particularly detrimental. When you use {@action Debilitating Strike}, you can apply two debilitations simultaneously; removing one removes both.

classFeature.name: Greater Weapon Specialization
entries: Your damage from weapon specialization increases to 4 with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert, 6 if you're a master, and 8 if you're legendary.

classFeature.name: Slippery Mind
entries: You play mental games and employ cognitive tricks to throw off mind-altering effects. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to master. When you roll a success at a Will save, you get a critical success instead.

classFeature.name: Light Armor Mastery
entries: Your skill with light armor improves, increasing your ability to dodge blows. Your proficiency ranks for light armor and unarmored defense increase to master.

classFeature.name: Master Strike
entries: You can incapacitate an unwary foe with a single strike. Your proficiency rank for your Lurjus class DC increases to master. You gain the {@action Master Strike} free action.

entries.name: Aavetemppuilija
entries: When it comes to a big heist, every Lurjus worth their salt knows that magic can throw meticulous plans into chaos, whether in the form of arcane wards or pesky divinations. You dabble in magic just enough to help handle these problems by jury-rigging spells and throwing a bit of your own magic into the mix. You might be a solitary Voro, performing burglaries that can't be explained by skill alone, or a specialist called in by other rogues to deal with magical security measures. You might even be on the up-and-up, hired to test magical defenses or even build them yourself.

Choose a multiclass archetype that has a basic, expert, and master spellcasting feat. You gain that archetype's dedication feat as a bonus feat even though you don't meet its level prerequisite, though you must meet its other prerequisites. For you, the {@feat Magical Trickster} Lurjus feat has a prerequisite of 2nd level instead of 4th level. You can choose the spellcasting ability score for the multiclass archetype you chose as your key ability score.

entries.name: Aivot
entries: Where others might use sleight of hand or a silver tongue to achieve their objectives, you rely on your intellect to craft intricate schemes. You likely view your operations as a chess game, always planning 10 steps ahead where others might plan three. You might be a detective determined to solve crimes or a spymaster in the service of a powerful family or nation. If you operate outside the law, you might be an aspiring crime lord or information broker, excellent at directing others toward suitable jobs.

If you successfully identify a creature using {@action Recall Knowledge|CRB}, that creature is {@condition flat-footed} against your attacks until the start of your next turn; if you critically succeed, it's {@condition flat-footed} against your attacks for 1 minute.

You're trained in {@skill Society} and one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Occultism}, or {@skill Religion}. You can choose Intelligence as your key ability score.

entries.name: Öykkäri
entries: You prefer to strong-arm or intimidate others rather than rely on finesse or fancy tricks. You might be an enforcer for organized crime, a highway bandit, or a noble who bullies others with threats of your family's power. Or, you might use your skills on the up and up, in a private security detail or as a guard in a city with the right temperament.

You use whatever tools you have at hand to get the job done. You can deal sneak attack damage with any simple weapon, in addition to the weapons listed in the sneak attack class feature. When you critically succeed at an attack roll using a simple weapon and the target has the {@condition flat-footed} condition (unable to focus on defending itself), you also apply the critical specialization effect for the weapon you're wielding. You don't gain these benefits if the weapon has a damage die larger than {@dice d8} (after applying any abilities that alter its damage die size).

You're trained in {@skill Intimidation} and medium armor. You can choose Strength as your key ability score. When you gain light armor expertise, you also gain expert proficiency in medium armor, and when you gain light armor mastery, you also gain master proficiency in medium armor.

entries.name: Junkkari
entries: You use fast-talking, flattery, and a silver tongue to avoid danger and escape tricky situations. You might be a grifter or con artist, traveling from place to place with a new story or scheme. Your Vedätys is also ideal for certain reputable professions, like barrister, diplomat, or politician.

When you successfully {@action Feint}, the target is {@condition flat-footed} against melee attacks you attempt against it until the end of your next turn. On a critical success, the target is {@condition flat-footed} against all melee attacks until the end of your next turn, not just yours.
You're trained in {@skill Deception} and {@skill Diplomacy}. You can choose Charisma as your key ability score.

entries.name: Voro
entries: Nothing beats the thrill of taking something that belongs to someone else, especially if you can do so completely unnoticed. You might be a pickpocket working the streets, a cat burglar sneaking through windows and escaping via rooftops, or a safecracker breaking into carefully guarded vaults. You might even work as a consultant, testing clients' defenses by trying to steal something precious.

When a fight breaks out, you prefer swift, lightweight weapons, and you strike where it hurts. When you attack with a {@trait finesse} melee weapon, you can add your Dexterity modifier to damage rolls instead of your Strength modifier.
You are trained in {@skill Thievery}.
